title: CRON NFS tests stall forever
body:
since the beginning of the con/tinuous collection of logs we have:

```shell
(git)smaug:/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/ci/logs/2021/05[master]git
$> git grep -B2 'No output has been received in the last'
25/cron/20210525T224617/69bb6b1/travis-11967-errored/15.txt-..
25/cron/20210525T224617/69bb6b1/travis-11967-errored/15.txt-
25/cron/20210525T224617/69bb6b1/travis-11967-errored/15.txt:No output has been received in the last 10m0s, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.
--
28/cron/20210528T190442/1c6afc4/travis-11976-errored/15.txt-E..
28/cron/20210528T190442/1c6afc4/travis-11976-errored/15.txt-
28/cron/20210528T190442/1c6afc4/travis-11976-errored/15.txt:No output has been received in the last 10m0s, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.
```

NFS testing was allowed to fail LONG ago in 105560892765604056539d5fa418d5f30612da79 apparently since "they just take too long" and "they make master look broken for no good reason" ... 
meanwhile -- later we added testing fresh git-annex builds tested (but on git actions) on NFS and they generally were green, which is a bit odd (need to doublecheck if all is "kosher there") since it seems NFS issues aren't behind us (e.g. see fresh https://git-annex.branchable.com/bugs/__34__357_out_of_984_tests_failed__34___on_NFS_lustre_mount/ with "357 out of 984 tests failed", although might be lustre not NFS issue)
